snippet: Forty-seven percent of the state’s voters said they favored the governor’s plan to pay for prekindergarten classes, but the wording of the question makes the results much less conclusive.
abstract: Quinnipiac University poll seems to give lift to New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo as he quarrels with New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio over best way to pay for prekindergarten classes; 47 percent of state’s voters say they favor governor’s plan to pay for prekindergarten classes, but wording of question makes results much less conclusive.

byline.contributor: Marjorie Connelly contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Forty-seven percent of the state’s voters said they favored the governor’s plan to pay for prekindergarten classes, but the wording of the question makes the results much less conclusive.

headline.main: Survey Suggests Voters Prefer Cuomo’s Proposal for Pre-K
headline.print_headline: Survey Suggests Voters Prefer Cuomo’s Proposal for Pre-K
